VM_NAME.title: VM_NAME
VM_NAME.description: Name of the VM which use this IVSHMEM.

VBDF.title: VBDF
VBDF.description: Bus, Device and function of the virtual device in VM . Set in hex.

IVSHMEM_VM.title: IVSHMEM_VM
IVSHMEM_VM.description: Set each VM which use this IVSHMEM.

PROVIDED_BY.title: Emulated by
PROVIDED_BY.description: Whether the shared memory region is emulated by the hypervisor or device model.

IVSHMEM_SIZE.title: Size
IVSHMEM_SIZE.description: Memory size of inter-VM shared memory (IVSHMEM) in megabytes. The value should be a power of 2 and no more than 512.

IVSHMEM_VMS.title: Shared VMs
IVSHMEM_VMS.description: Set all VMs which use this IVSHMEM.

RDT_ENABLED.title: Intel Resource Director Technology
RDT_ENABLED.description: Enable the Intel Resource Director Technology (RDT) allocation feature. If the board hardware does not support RDT, setting this option to y is ignored.

CDP_ENABLED.title: Code and Data Prioritization
CDP_ENABLED.description: Specify whether to enable Code and Data Prioritization (CDP). CDP is an extension of CAT. Set to 'y' to enable the feature or 'n' to disable it. The 'y' will be ignored when hardware does not support CDP.

VCAT_ENABLED.title: VCAT_ENABLED
VCAT_ENABLED.description: Specify whether to enable CAT virtualization (vCAT). Set to 'y' to enable the feature or 'n' to disable it. The 'y' will be ignored when hardware does not support CAT.

CLOS_MASK.title: CLOS_MASK
CLOS_MASK.description: Specify the cache capacity bitmask for the CLOS; only continuous '1' bits are allowed. The value will be ignored when hardware does not support RDT. This option takes effect only if hv.FEATURES.RDT.RDT_ENABLED is set to y. As vm.clos.vcpu_clos specifies the index of the CLOS to be associated with the given vCPU, hv.FEATURES.RDT.CLOS_MASK of that CLOS would impact the performance of the given vCPU.

SSRAM_ENABLED.title: Software SRAM
SSRAM_ENABLED.description: Enable the Software SRAM feature for real-time VMs. This feature reserves memory buffers as always-cached memory for improved VM performance.

pcpu_id.title: pcpu_id
pcpu_id.description: A pCPU that this VM's vCPU is allowed to pin to.

vcpu_clos.title: vcpu_clos
vcpu_clos.description:
By default (virtual_cat_support is not specified): vcpu_clos is per-CPU and it configures each CPU in VMs to a desired CLOS ID in the VM section of the scenario file. Follow rdt_detection_capabilities to identify the maximum supported CLOS ID that can be used.

If virtual_cat_support is specified: vcpu_clos is not per-CPU anymore, just a list of physical CLOSIDs (minimum 2) that are assigned to VMs for vCAT use. Each vcpu_clos will be mapped to a virtual CLOSID, the first vcpu_clos is mapped to virtual CLOSID 0 and the second is mapped to virtual CLOSID 1, etc.

base.title: base
base.description: Specify SGX EPC section base, must be page aligned. (Default value is 0)

size.title: size
size.description: Specify SGX EPC section size in Bytes, must be page aligned. (Default value is 0)

whole.title: VM physical memory allocation (MB)
whole.description: Specify the physical memory allocated to this VM in Megabytes.

start_hpa.title: start_hpa
start_hpa.description: The starting physical address in host for the VM.

size.title: size
size.description: The memory size in bytes for the VM. Default value is 0x200000000.

start_hpa2.title: start_hpa2
start_hpa2.description: Start of second HPA for non-contiguous allocations in host for the VM.

size_hpa2.title: size_hpa2
size_hpa2.description: Memory size of second HPA for non-contiguous allocations in Bytes for the VM.

kern_type.title: Kernel image type
kern_type.description: Specify the kernel image type so the hypervisor can load it correctly.

kern_mod.title: Kernel module tag
kern_mod.description: Enter the tag for the kernel image that is used as a multiboot module. It must exactly match the module tag in the GRUB multiboot cmdline.

ramdisk_mod.title: RAMdisk module tag
ramdisk_mod.description: Specify the tag for the ramdisk image that is used as a multiboot module. It must exactly match the module tag in the GRUB multiboot cmdline.

bootargs.title: Kernel boot arguments
bootargs.description: Specify configurable boot argument for pre-launched or Service VM.

kern_load_addr.title: kern_load_addr
kern_load_addr.description: The loading address in host memory for the VM kernel.

kern_entry_addr.title: kern_entry_addr
kern_entry_addr.description: The entry address in host memory for the VM kernel.

TPM2.title: Trusted Platform Module passthrough
TPM2.description: Passthrough the Trusted Platform Module (TPM2) device to this VM. (Optional) (Default value is n)

p2sb.title: Primary-to-Sideband bridge passthrough
p2sb.description: Passthrough the P2SB (Primary-to-Sideband) bridge register access BAR to the this VM. (Optional) (Default value is n)

pci_dev.title: PCI device assignment
pci_dev.description: Select the PCI devices you want to assign to this virtual machine.

BUILD_TYPE.title: Build type
BUILD_TYPE.description: Identify build type. Debug mode enables debug shell, prints, and logs. Release mode optimizes the ACRN binary for deployment and turns off all debug infrastructure. These can only be changed at build time.

SERIAL_CONSOLE.title: Serial console port
SERIAL_CONSOLE.description: Specify the host serial device used for hypervisor debugging.

MEM_LOGLEVEL.title: ACRN log level
MEM_LOGLEVEL.description: Specify default log level for log messages stored in memory. Value can be changed at runtime. Log messages with the selected value or lower are displayed.

NPK_LOGLEVEL.title: Intel Trace Hub log level
NPK_LOGLEVEL.description: Specify default log level for the hypervisor via Intel Trace Hub log. Use the Intel Trace Hub's memory to record log messages. Value can be changed at runtime. Log messages with the selected value or lower are displayed.

CONSOLE_LOGLEVEL.title: Serial console log level
CONSOLE_LOGLEVEL.description: Specify default log level for log messages written to the serial console. Log messages with the selected value or lower are displayed.

RELOC.title: Hypervisor relocation in memory
RELOC.description: Enable hypervisor relocation in memory. The boot loader may need to change the location of the hypervisor because of other firmware.

SCHEDULER.title: Scheduler and workload prioritization
SCHEDULER.description: Choose scheduling algorithm used for determining which User VM runs on a shared virtual CPU.

MULTIBOOT2.title: Enable Multiboot2
MULTIBOOT2.description: Enable multiboot2 boot protocol support and multiboot1 downward compatibility. Disable this feature if multiboot1 meets your requirements and to reduce lines of code.

ENFORCE_TURNOFF_AC.title: Split lock detection
ENFORCE_TURNOFF_AC.description: Enable split lock detection for real-time application. This prevents alignment check exceptions from impacting hypervisor real-time performance.

ENFORCE_TURNOFF_GP.title: Prevent system bus locking
ENFORCE_TURNOFF_GP.description: Enable UC lock detection for real-time application. This prevents general protection faults from impacting hypervisor real-time performance.

SECURITY_VM_FIXUP.title: SECURITY_VM_FIXUP
SECURITY_VM_FIXUP.description: Enable to do fixup for TPM2 and SMBIOS for Security VM. If no Security VM, setting this option to n

KEEP_IRQ_DISABLED.title: KEEP_IRQ_DISABLED
KEEP_IRQ_DISABLED.description: If y, permanently disables all interrupts in HV root mode.

RDT.title: Intel Resource Director Technology
RDT.description: Enable Intel Resource Director Technology (RDT). The technology provides cache and memory allocation features to improve time performance of real-time VMs.

HYPERV_ENABLED.title: TLFS support for Windows
HYPERV_ENABLED.description: Enable Microsoft(R) Hypervisor Top-Level Functional Specification for Windows hyper-v support.

IOMMU_ENFORCE_SNP.title: IOMMU_ENFORCE_SNP
IOMMU_ENFORCE_SNP.description: Specify if the IOMMU enforces snoop behavior of DMA operations.

ACPI_PARSE_ENABLED.title: Parse ACPI tables at runtime
ACPI_PARSE_ENABLED.description: Enable ACPI runtime parsing to get DMAR (DMA remapping) configuration data from the APCI tables. Otherwise, use existing, static information from the associated board.xml file.

L1D_VMENTRY_ENABLED.title: Mitigate L1 terminal fault
L1D_VMENTRY_ENABLED.description: Enable L1 cache flush before VM entry,Determine the enabling of mitigation solution for L1 Terminal Fault (L1TF). The L1 data cache will be flushed before each VMENTRY.L1TF is a speculative execution side channel cache timing vulnerability. Each variety of L1TF could potentially allow unauthorized disclosure of information residing in the L1 data cache.

MCE_ON_PSC_DISABLED.title: MCE workaround
MCE_ON_PSC_DISABLED.description: Enable software workaround for Machine Check Error on Page Size Change (silicon bug in some processor families).

STACK_SIZE.title: Stack size (in byte)
STACK_SIZE.description: Capacity of one stack (in bytes) used by a physical core. Each core uses one stack for normal operation and another three for specific exceptions.

HV_RAM_START.title: HV_RAM_START
HV_RAM_START.description: The 2MB-aligned starting physical address of the RAM region used by the hypervisor.

IOMMU_BUS_NUM.title: IOMMU_BUS_NUM
IOMMU_BUS_NUM.description: Highest PCI bus ID used during IOMMU initialization.

MAX_PCI_DEV_NUM.title: Maximum number of PCI devices
MAX_PCI_DEV_NUM.description: Specify the static memory allocation of maximum number of PCI devices. (Default value is 96)

MAX_IOAPIC_LINES.title: MAX_IOAPIC_LINES
MAX_IOAPIC_LINES.description: Maximum number of interrupt lines per IOAPIC.

MAX_PT_IRQ_ENTRIES.title: MAX_PT_IRQ_ENTRIES
MAX_PT_IRQ_ENTRIES.description: The pre-defined number of interrupt sources of all pass-through devices.

MAX_MSIX_TABLE_NUM.title: MAX_MSIX_TABLE_NUM
MAX_MSIX_TABLE_NUM.description: Specify maximum number of MSI-X tables per device. If this value is empty, then the default value will be calculated from the board XML file. (Default value is 64)

MAX_EMULATED_MMIO.title: MAX_EMULATED_MMIO
MAX_EMULATED_MMIO.description: Specify maximum number of emulated MMIO regions. (Default value is 16)

GPU_SBDF.title: GPU_SBDF
GPU_SBDF.description: Segment, Bus, Device, and function of the GPU.

vuart_connections.title: Virtual UART connection
vuart_connections.description: Specify the vUART connection setting. Refer to vuart_config for detailed vUART settings.

name.title: VM name
name.description: Type in the name used to identify each VM. The VM name will be shown in the hypervisor console vm_list command.

secure_world_support.title: secure_world_support
secure_world_support.description: Specify secure world support for trustry OS.

hide_mtrr_support.title: hide_mtrr_support
hide_mtrr_support.description: Specify MTRR capability to hide for VM.

cpu_affinity.title: Physical CPU affinity
cpu_affinity.description: List of pCPU that this VM's vCPUs are pinned to.

clos.title: clos
clos.description: Class of Service for Cache Allocation Technology. Refer SDM 17.19.2 for details, and use with caution.

epc_section.title: epc_section
epc_section.description: Specify SGX Enclave Page Cache section base and size in byte. It must be page aligned.

memory.title: memory
memory.description: Specify memory information for Service and User VMs.

priority.title: priority
priority.description: Specify the VM vCPU priority for scheduling.

companion_vmid.title: companion_vmid
companion_vmid.description: Specify the companion VM id of this VM.

os_config.title: os_config
os_config.description: General information for host kernel, boot argument and memory.

console_vuart.title: console_vuart
console_vuart.description: Specify the console vUART (aka PCI based vUART) with the vUART ID by its id attribute.

pt_intx.title: pt_intx
pt_intx.description: Determine the static memory size of pt_intx array. It is used to describe the pre-launched VM owned ioapic pins and the corresponding mapping between physical GSI and virtual GSI.

PTM.title: Precision Time Measurement
PTM.description: Enable virtualization of PCIE Precision Time Measurement (PTM) mechanism for devices with PTM capability and for real-time application. HV provides PCIE root port emulation instead of host bridge emulation for VM , PTM could coordinate timing between device and root port with device’s local timebases without relying on software.

os_type.title: OS type
os_type.description: Specify user VM OS type, for config tool to format the DM commandline. If it is windows, then add -windows to DM parameter. It supports Oracle virtio-blk, virtio-net and virtio-input devices for Windows guests with secure boot. For windows guest vm this option is mandatory for running Windows in a User VM. If it is not used, Windows will not recognize the virtual disk. When it is linux like OS , config tool also format the related parameters in the same way.

vbootloader.title: OVMF (Open Virtual Machine Firmware)
vbootloader.description: Specify if to use virtual boot loader OVMF (Open Virtual Machine Firmware) to boot User VM, right now ovmf is the only virtual boot loader supported. User could also disable this to use another boot protocol with parameter -K set.

vuart0.title: Emulate COM1 as standard I/O
vuart0.description: Enable ACRN Device Model to emulate COM1 as a User VM standard IO.

usb_xhci.title: usb_xhci
usb_xhci.description: Device model emulates USB controller used to support USB 3.0 devices, (also supports USB 2.0 and USB 1.0 devices). The physical USB devices attached on the specified bus and port in service VM will be detected by User VM and used as expected as parameters setting.

[@]stdio|tty|pty|sock:portname[=portpath][,[@]stdio|tty|pty:portname[=portpath]]

network.description:
The virtio network device setting.

Input format: device_name[,vhost][,mac=XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX]. The device_name is the name of the TAP (or MacVTap) device. It must include the keyword tap. vhost specifies the vhost backend; otherwise, the VBSU backend is used. The mac address is optional.

block.description:

Format: [blk partition:][img path] e.g.: /dev/sda3:./a/b.img

size.description: The memory size in bytes for the VM. Default value is 0x200000000.

start_hpa2.title: start_hpa2
start_hpa2.description: Start of second HPA for non-contiguous allocations in host for the VM.

size_hpa2.title: size_hpa2
size_hpa2.description: Memory size of second HPA for non-contiguous allocations in Bytes for the VM.

clos.title: clos
clos.description: Class of Service for Cache Allocation Technology. Refer SDM 17.19.2 for details, and use with caution.

epc_section.title: epc_section
epc_section.description: Specify SGX Enclave Page Cache section base and size in byte. It must be page aligned.

memory.title: memory
memory.description: Specify memory information for Service and User VMs.

pt_intx.title: pt_intx
pt_intx.description: Determine the static memory size of pt_intx array. It is used to describe the pre-launched VM owned ioapic pins and the corresponding mapping between physical GSI and virtual GSI.

PTM.title: Precision Time Measurement
PTM.description: Enable virtualization of PCIE Precision Time Measurement (PTM) mechanism for devices with PTM capability and for real-time application. HV provides PCIE root port emulation instead of host bridge emulation for VM , PTM could coordinate timing between device and root port with device’s local timebases without relying on software.

RELOC.title: Hypervisor relocation in memory
RELOC.description: Enable hypervisor relocation in memory. The boot loader may need to change the location of the hypervisor because of other firmware.

SCHEDULER.title: Scheduler and workload prioritization
SCHEDULER.description: Choose scheduling algorithm used for determining which User VM runs on a shared virtual CPU.

MULTIBOOT2.title: Enable Multiboot2
MULTIBOOT2.description: Enable multiboot2 boot protocol support and multiboot1 downward compatibility. Disable this feature if multiboot1 meets your requirements and to reduce lines of code.

ENFORCE_TURNOFF_AC.title: Split lock detection
ENFORCE_TURNOFF_AC.description: Enable split lock detection for real-time application. This prevents alignment check exceptions from impacting hypervisor real-time performance.

ENFORCE_TURNOFF_GP.title: Prevent system bus locking
ENFORCE_TURNOFF_GP.description: Enable UC lock detection for real-time application. This prevents general protection faults from impacting hypervisor real-time performance.

RDT.title: Intel Resource Director Technology
RDT.description: Enable Intel Resource Director Technology (RDT). The technology provides cache and memory allocation features to improve time performance of real-time VMs.

HYPERV_ENABLED.title: TLFS support for Windows
HYPERV_ENABLED.description: Enable Microsoft(R) Hypervisor Top-Level Functional Specification for Windows hyper-v support.

ACPI_PARSE_ENABLED.title: Parse ACPI tables at runtime
ACPI_PARSE_ENABLED.description: Enable ACPI runtime parsing to get DMAR (DMA remapping) configuration data from the APCI tables. Otherwise, use existing, static information from the associated board.xml file.

L1D_VMENTRY_ENABLED.title: Mitigate L1 terminal fault
L1D_VMENTRY_ENABLED.description: Enable L1 cache flush before VM entry,Determine the enabling of mitigation solution for L1 Terminal Fault (L1TF). The L1 data cache will be flushed before each VMENTRY.L1TF is a speculative execution side channel cache timing vulnerability. Each variety of L1TF could potentially allow unauthorized disclosure of information residing in the L1 data cache.

MCE_ON_PSC_DISABLED.title: MCE workaround
MCE_ON_PSC_DISABLED.description: Enable software workaround for Machine Check Error on Page Size Change (silicon bug in some processor families).

STACK_SIZE.title: Stack size (in byte)
STACK_SIZE.description: Capacity of one stack (in bytes) used by a physical core. Each core uses one stack for normal operation and another three for specific exceptions.

MAX_PCI_DEV_NUM.title: Maximum number of PCI devices
MAX_PCI_DEV_NUM.description: Specify the static memory allocation of maximum number of PCI devices. (Default value is 96)

MAX_PT_IRQ_ENTRIES.title: MAX_PT_IRQ_ENTRIES
MAX_PT_IRQ_ENTRIES.description: The pre-defined number of interrupt sources of all pass-through devices.

MAX_MSIX_TABLE_NUM.title: MAX_MSIX_TABLE_NUM
MAX_MSIX_TABLE_NUM.description: Specify maximum number of MSI-X tables per device. If this value is empty, then the default value will be calculated from the board XML file. (Default value is 64)

MAX_EMULATED_MMIO.title: MAX_EMULATED_MMIO
MAX_EMULATED_MMIO.description: Specify maximum number of emulated MMIO regions. (Default value is 16)
